intro: Stenopetalum anfractum, commonly known as the narrow-petaled rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with narrow petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its foliage consists of small, leathery leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Stenopetalum anfractum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native insect species.
